channel.title: CVE Feed for Jenkins project -- Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Jenkins project -- Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin

item.title: CVE-2022-25176|2024-08-03T04:36:05.777Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20pipeline%3A%20groovy%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2648.va9433432b33c and earlier follows symbolic links to locations outside of the checkout directory for the configured SCM when reading the script file (typically Jenkinsfile) for Pipelines, allowing attackers able to configure Pipelines to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

item.title: CVE-2022-30945|2024-08-03T07:03:40.031Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20pipeline%3A%20groovy%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2689.v434009a_31b_f1 and earlier allows loading any Groovy source files on the classpath of Jenkins and Jenkins plugins in sandboxed pipelines.

item.title: CVE-2022-25180|2024-08-03T04:36:06.394Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20pipeline%3A%20groovy%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2648.va9433432b33c and earlier includes password parameters from the original build in replayed builds, allowing attackers with Run/Replay permission to obtain the values of password parameters passed to previous builds of a Pipeline.

item.title: CVE-2022-43402|2024-08-03T13:32:58.640Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20pipeline%3A%20groovy%20plugin
item.description: A sandbox bypass vulnerability involving various casts performed implicitly by the Groovy language runtime in Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2802.v5ea_628154b_c2 and earlier allows attackers with permission to define and run sandboxed scripts, including Pipelines, to bypass the sandbox protection and execute arbitrary code in the context of the Jenkins controller JVM.

item.title: CVE-2022-25173|2024-08-03T04:36:05.779Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20pipeline%3A%20groovy%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2648.va9433432b33c and earlier uses the same checkout directories for distinct SCMs when reading the script file (typically Jenkinsfile) for Pipelines, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to invoke arbitrary OS commands on the controller through crafted SCM contents.
